bow: feel like hungover on pregnancy had my gallbladder taken out and then about months later found out was pregnant whooo this is happy thing dont want to sound ungrateful because really am so thrilled to be mom but wish could put the breaks on all the sickness feel like im on the ocean in tiny little boat all day sorry for the tmi but my poop is never solid have lost 16 pounds in around weeks definitely not trying to cant eat without throwing up its struggle my next docotors appointment is in days and plan on speaking with my ob about all of this but in the mean time would really like some advice from some people who have been tmhere before know im not the only one lol have tried crackers gingerale lemon water peppermint and have recently had someone suggest seaband ever heard of it at this point would do the hokey pokey and turn myself around if you said it would help thanks in advance glad you re seeing your doctor soon it could be more serious than my experience but you re symptoms sound familiar was very sick through all three of mine but learned that my condition was similar to hypoglycemia had to avoid sugar and foods that were high in simple carbs also had to eat snack at least every two hours if waited to long between snacks would become too nauseous to hold anything down hope this helps removed weirdly for me fresh air helped walk around the block with bottle of water and it definitely helped my sickness and mental health best of luck hope you feel better soon vitamin b6 was game changer for me didn completely take the nausea away but it helped reduce my vomiting and allowed me to eat also stopped trying to eat what thought should be eating and instead just ate whatever could stomach lots of saltines ginger ale and other carbs those first couple of months it gets better my ob gyn had me take unisom tablets not geltabs that was important for some reason and vitamin b6 every night for the nausea it actually too the edge off and was able to sort of function for while then he prescribed me zofran and it was way more helpful lol but the unisom b6 combo actually helped go see an acupuncturist who specializes in this and have them gua sha your back instant relief have gb issues myself and make ginger tea with kudzu kukicha twig tea and umeboshi plum paste kudzu is like corn starch to you need to liquefy it in cold water first sounds weird and foreign but amazing for nausea and diarrhea mine was explosive ended it like that seabands work great for me for seasickness on cruise can even look at carousel without getting queasy normally know you can get them at target fresh air and eating literally whatever felt like in the moment even if it wasn super healthy or nutrient dense was my saving grace food is better than no food and will likely make you feel bit less nauseous at the very least drove around with either french baguette or sourdough loaf in my car at any given time for weeks just in case felt hunger pang which would be followed by wave of nausea or vomiting if it had not been honored some other foods found relief from were pasta with butter sandwiches pancakes pizza and muffins basically anything with ton of carbs was what lived off of until the middle of the 2nd trimester if you get sick on consistent basis don be afraid to ask for zofran while it didn alleviate my sickness completely it did take the edge off and made life tolerable also if you do get sick and can keep anything down sucking on pedialyte or gatorade ice cubes is good way to get some electrolytes back in your body broth is good too as it is bland and has lots of sodium lastly promise you with everything ve got it is sooooo worth it and one day this will all be over you ve got this this sounds exactly like what went through the nausea felt never ending and lasted all day my doctor prescribed me diclectin and took it for my entire pregnancy made me feel totally normal again wish had started it earlier found salvation in apples and sparkling water this 100 the unisom and b6 was amazing took it for my entire 1st trimester also cold things helped me lot popsicles cold fruit like cut up melon and juice peanut butter don know why it works but someone else recommended it to me and it really helped ask about hyperemesis gravidum zofran generic is odansetron is an anti nausea med safe in pregnancy category call your doctor today if you can weight loss is serious in pregnancy and so are vitamin deficiencies make sure you are taking prenatal vitamin sorry you are dealing with all this cholestatic diarrhoea is common after gallbladder removal but it sounds like you are dealing with it little longer than normal hang in there was put on diclegis during my first pregnancy and it saved my life was so sick all the time life was miserable talk to your ob and see what they can do for you had awful morning sickness tried all you listed sea bands the unisom b6 and even prescription from the doctor which is the only thing that ever helped but ever so slightly the only thing that unfortunately really worked was time and once was few weeks into the second trimester felt good again best of luck for anyone else that is confused on the unisom gels vs tablets thing they re different medication the gel caps are diphenhydramine aka benadryl and the tablets are doxylamine both are antihistamines but are different medications just fyi hahahhaha get it super original commenting 11 do know that sea band will solve all your issues but it drug free and it ca hurt used them when we went sailing on our babymoon at months pregnant and they were super helpful also ginger tea for me was more helpful than ginger ale got fresh raw ginger cut hunk off and steeped it in boiling water with chamomile tea bag guess cause it was way bigger hit of ginger little sweetener might help too liked honey or agave but just drop second the accupuncture recommendation barfed every day with my daughter but my midwives weren concerned amp didn think it warranted medication acupuncture helped with the nausea and helped me sleep also had gd so couldn eat whatever want ended up with healthy baby even though only gained four pounds since we are talking poop is is green or yellow or almost like mountain dew sometimes you could have post cholecystectomy syndrome basically your body is dumping too much bile into your digestive tract and causing diarrhea because your gall bladder used to regulate that for you the color in your stool is the extra bile just possibility it can be controlled with medication the medication tastes like you re drinking orange chalk but it helps lot good things about not having gallbladder while pregnant was never constipated not once also you don have to worry about gallstones giving you issues bad things puking with no gallbladder is way worse hated it so much try peppermints or peppermint water drop or two of peppermint extract in oz really cold water you may want to talk to your doctor as some things say that it can cause contractions my ob didn have any issues and peppermint helped make me feel like my mouth was clean even though could hardly brush without triggering my gag reflex and get rid of the taste it also worked way better than ginger for me hope you feel better soon more insurance companies are beginning to cover the brand name of this combination diclegis behind the pharmacy counter about two pregnancies too late for me but good thing nonetheless had hyperemesis gravidarum which you sound like you may have google pinkstork they have products that help all this you may need to discuss iv therapy with your doc if you mean you have vertigo disequilibrium as well as nausea you may be having high blood pressure otherwise morning sickness sucks am sorry try unisom+b12 supplement ve had hg all three pregnancies and at the start of this one read that laying on my stomach could stop the nausea it worked it does kill productivity and after awhile could anymore because my uterus got in the way but for awhile it did the trick also take nausea drug now as well and it really helps have your doctors prescribe you bonjesta it been life saver for me ice chips are great way to hydrate without overloading your stomach if you have tried it just suck on it for bit the ob will have better tips just be 100 honest with them took this with my second pregnancy and found it so helpful much less drowsy then the over the counter combo should take the additional b6 even with my prenatal vitamins will definitely be asking about the unisom tablets though will have to give that try live in the country so there is plenty of fresh air for me to wander about in thanks for the advice their office is open tomorrow morning and going to give them call like super yellow like highlighter my tiny little hometown doesnt have target but there is always good ol amazon just dont know why they would work for morning sickness since they are for motion sickness mean few people that have mentioned them swear by them for morning sickness but just cant wrap my head around it actually just had my gallbladder taken out week ago and from what ve seen online your doctor can recommend metamucil for the bm which think they would know is safe during pregnancy as far as the nausea they do have medicine but what worked for me in pregnancy was the brat diet bananas rice apples toast best of wishes if small change in diet does help either of those symptoms then it would definitely be best to take what they recommend you ll need all th nutrients you can get for you and baby thank you actually went and bought some popsicles today something inside me told me that really needed ice and just couldnt resist when walked past them lol am totally down for the french baguette in the car pregnant or not haha yeah would talk to your gastroenterologist they determined that the medicine cholestyramine was safe for pregnancy and took it during both of mine been on it for about years your doctor could have different opinion or may not think you have the syndrome mine also took several months to develop after surgery will also ask about this havent ever hear of diclectin is this name brand generic name of another medication no idea never took prenatal vitamins because they made me barf so it was an issue hopefully someone with more knowledge will chime in thank you am honestly just wanting so badly for time to speed up to the 2nd trimester and know that even then its not guaranteed that wont be sick anymore but like you said have tried everything minus the doctors prescription recommendation which will try and im getting desperate here lol love chamomile but honestly had even thought of this will give it try unison and b6 took the edge off some days and others it didn seem to help at all so don be afraid to discuss other options if it not working too great have heard lot of good things about acupuncture the only problem with doing that is that the nearest acupuncturist is almost hours away from my little tiny home town for me it helped little bit but it wasn magical fix can barely brush my teeth without gagging either oh my goodness my gag reflex has gotten so bad but im right with you with the lack of constipation maybe should count my blessings there haha before getting pregnant was all about being warm and bundled up discovered that this made my nausea worse so turn down the house wear colder clothes drink ice water etc and cool down that nausea being from an area that is overrun with kudzu honestly didnt think it was good for anything will probably end up trying this tea just because of the connection to the kudzu dont worry im gon na get my kudzu online and not from the outdoors lol actually do put lot of faith in herbal remedies though so thank you for this recommendation 17 weeks here seabands did nothing for me zofran is apparently being linked to more birth defects ask about bonjesta yes my ob had me taking that combo on top of my prenatal to help morning sickness it helped so much used seabands every day and took extra vitamin during the first trimester as other people commented at worst they would do nothing and at best they may offer you some relief there is no harm in trying them to see if they could help you good luck also wanted to mention that tried the seaband mama because like yourself had it bad and was desperate for relief but they did absolutely nothing everyone is different so give it try if you want but it was waste of money for me fyi my on recently told me zofran is no longer preferred and possibly unsafe diclegis b6 and an antihistamine believe like unisom is used now yep that the brand name it combination of pyridoxine and doxylamine this was six years ago thats so cool its wacky because it this special thing in japan yet grows out of control here it vert nice and soothing diclegus which is unison and vitamins took the edge off but was miserable in my first pregnancy my girl pregnancy vs my boy pregnancy were totally different would suggest ice water always made me throw up sniffing peppermint essential oil helped ate mashed potatoes with no flavoring was prescribed an antinausea medicine that helped but it knocked me out the biggest thing learned was to never drink fluids on an empty stomach try not to let your stomach get empty even if you just nibble on cracker had no desire to eat but forced myself salty french fries helped little think lived on potatoes yes most prenatals do not contain significant doses of bcomplex vitamins good news is that diclegis was reauthorized in the couple years ago it basically the rx time release version of the unisom b6 combo it worked wonders for me with my most recent pg used zofran with my first pg but it has some contraindications since last used it almost decade ago felt that diclegis was safer option and had far fewer negative side effects but it all depends on your particular case with the zofran had to be on other meds just to manage the side effects so it was like moving from the worst level of hell to like few floors higher but still in hell lol welcome to the hyperemesis gravidum club joined couple support groups on babycenter and fb not sure if any subs here and those were great source of support like any chronic illness you need it so do feel guilty or like complainer at all you have lost lot of weight if you re getting dehydrated or ca stop vomiting for hours get yourself to the nearest er for fluids and they ll give you an emergency dose of nausea meds until you can get in to your dr definitely had this and both my sons turned out perfectly motherrisk told me it was one of the most studied drugs during pregnancy and there were no negative outcomes as of yet also bananas apple sauce toast and rice are your friend for the diarrhea call tomorrow and get in sooner had severe morning sickness recently and lost the baby regret not calling sooner it might not have been because waited but ll never know paid for brand with both my pregnancies and found no relief but by that point had exhausted everything from zofran to phenergan suppositories so it was surprising hyperemesis really kills that pregnancy excitement sorry had severe morning sickness the entire length of my pregnancies but know that nothing compared to hg had pregnancy book with line like pregnancy is miracle dry crackers first thing in the morning can make the miracle slightly less unpleasant am right there with you in my second trimester and still deal with morning sickness am on zofran zoloft and reglan also live where weed is legal so smoke enough in the morning to take away the sickness and get an appetite this was last resort decision but it helped and works wonders for me being able to eat lost 15 pounds before started smoking and ve gained about 12 back obviously won continue smoking weed because don want to ruin their lungs but you got ta win some and lose some just to be able to get up and face the day this will sound weird but also lost weight due to constant nausea and at least every other day throwing up and the one thing could count on was taco bell beefy layer bean burrito not the specialty burritos not the tacos just that one may want to try and see if it fails at least it was cheap removed frozen blueberries help just don freak out if your stool looks like coffee grounds this is warning sign for colorectal cancer or frozen grapes the prenatal vitamins made me puke because they were too big wound up taking gummy vitamins dha calcium chews and folic acid took magnesium too later in pregnancy due to insane leg cramps seriously though try it you won be sorry and you will finish the baguette within or days haha popsicles gave me life was big fan of those red white and blue ones gt suggest seaband ever heard of it my mum uses these for seasickness they press on some points in your wrists that relieves seasickness like acupuncture but more portable
